original: 2. Grant of License.
ollama_generated:
2. Permission to Use Intellectual Property (License).

Subject to the terms herein, Licensor grants User a non-exclusive, revocable, and non-transferable right to use its Intellectual Property solely for the intended purpose as described in this Agreement. Any other use is expressly prohibited unless otherwise agreed upon by both parties in writing. The User acknowledges that any unauthorized use may result in termination of the License with immediate effect.

original: (a) Products. Upon the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, KI, Inc. hereby grants to Diplomat and Diplomat hereby accepts the right, license and privilege of utilizing KI's name and likeness solely upon and in connection with the manufacture, sale and distribution of the following products:
ollama_generated:
(a) Authorized Products. In accordance with the terms and conditions outlined in this Agreement, Diplomat is granted, and KI, Inc. consents, to the use of KI's name, trademark, and likeness for the production, marketing, and distribution of certain products, subject to the following limitations:

1. Exclusive Jurisdiction: Such use is exclusive to Diplomat and may not be sub-licensed or transferred to any third party without prior written consent from KI, Inc.
2. Quality Control: Diplomat shall ensure that all products bearing KI's name, trademark, or likeness comply with the quality standards set forth by KI, Inc., as communicated to Diplomat in writing.
3. Product Recall: In case of any defect or issue arising from a product utilizing KI's intellectual property, Diplomat shall be solely responsible for managing and executing a recall, at its own expense, in consultation with KI, Inc. to mitigate potential harm to consumers and maintain the reputation of KI's brand.
4. Indemnification: Diplomat agrees to indemnify and hold KI, Inc. harmless from any claims, damages, or expenses arising out of or in connection with the manufacturing, sale, or distribution of the products in question, except for those caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of KI, Inc.
5. Termination: Upon termination of this Agreement, Diplomat shall cease using KI's name, trademark, or likeness in any capacity and remove all associated branding from its products.
6. Dispute Resolution: Any disputes arising out of or related to this section shall be resolved through mediation before initiating any legal proceedings against KI, Inc.

KI, Inc.'s consent to the use of its intellectual property in this context is not an endorsement, sponsorship, or partnership with Diplomat, but rather a business arrangement aimed at expanding the reach of both parties' products.

original: (b) Territory. The license hereby granted extends worldwide.
modified: (b) Territory. For clarity, the granted license is limited to territories excluding those where local laws expressly prohibit the use of the licensed materials.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, if royalties paid by Diplomat to KI, Inc. on net wholesale volume for any particular License Year under subparagraph 3(a) of this Agreement should exceed the minimum royalties remaining to be paid for that same License Year under this subparagraph 3(b), then no further payments of minimum royalties for such License Year shall be required under this subparagraph 3(b).
ollama_generated:
(1) For the Initial Licensing Period (August 1, 1995 - January 30, 1997): $

        The minimum royalty for the Initial Licensing Period shall be structured as follows: A lump sum of $ upon signing of the Deal Memo dated August 24, 1995, followed by five (5) subsequent, equal monthly installments of $ commencing from the month following the execution of this Agreement. It is clearly understood that any minimum royalties paid during the Initial Licensing Period, as stipulated in this subsection 3(b), are non-refundable to Diplomat. original: KI and the members of her entourage shall travel via first class air and portal-to-portal limousine ground transportation. In addition, KI and the members of her entourage shall be lodged in first class hotel accommodations and all of them shall be reimbursed for all meals and other incidental expenses in connection with such appearances. All the above travel expenses of KI and the members of her entourage shall be billed directly to Diplomat. For purposes of this paragraph (c), the term "travel expenses" shall include (d) Photo Sessions. KI will participate in up to two (2) photo sessions per License Year during the period of this Agreement on behalf of Diplomat at a mutually acceptable time and place. The photo sessions shall be scheduled at KI's convenience upon not less than two (2) weeks prior notice, and shall be subject to KI's preexisting personal and professional commitments. The photo sessions shall be up to two (2) consecutive days in duration, each day to consist of no more than eight (8) working hours. The photo shoots shall be produced by SW, approved in writing by Diplomat (which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld), and all images produced from the photo sessions shall be the property of SW. The parties agree that all images from the photo sessions shall be retouched at the expense of Diplomat. In recognition of SW's expenses in connection with the above photo sessions, Diplomat shall pay SW the sum of $       per day for each day (or partial day) of such photo sessions. It is understood by the parties that such sum shall include all expenses required to provide Diplomat with positive film (excluding travel expenses of KI, as set forth in this Agreement), and that such sum contemplates a typical location for such photo sessions. If a more elaborate set-up for such photo sessions is required, and such set-up is mutually agreed to by the parties, then the above sum shall be increased to such amount as the parties shall agree. The above sum shall not include retouching images.
modified:
KI and their associates are granted premium economy air travel and limousine service for door-to-door transportation on the ground. Accommodation will be provided in luxury hotels, and all related expenses, including meals and incidentals connected with these engagements, will not be charged to KI or their entourage. Instead, Diplomat shall bear the costs of these travel arrangements, with the exception of personal expenses for KI and their associates, as detailed in this agreement.

In relation to this section (c), the term "travel expenses" will exclude Photo Sessions. Upon request from Diplomat, KI will consent to participate in up to two (2) photo sessions annually during the term of this Agreement, subject to a mutually convenient time and location and reasonable notice of at least two weeks. These sessions may last for no more than eight (8) hours per day over a maximum of two (2) consecutive days.

The production of these photo shoots will be managed by SW, with Diplomat's prior written approval required. All images derived from the photo sessions shall become the property of SW. Diplomat acknowledges responsibility for retouching the images as part of their expenses related to these photo sessions. In consideration of SW's costs associated with these photo shoots (excluding travel costs for KI, as outlined in this agreement), Diplomat will remunerate SW a fee of $      per day (or partial day) for each photo session day. The parties agree that this sum is intended for an average location and covers all necessary expenses, excluding additional costs associated with more elaborate set-ups, should they be mutually agreed upon by the parties. Any additional costs due to such elaborate set-ups will be added to the agreed fee. The remuneration does not cover retouching images.

original: Diplomat agrees that the products covered by this Agreement shall be of such style, appearance and quality as to be adequate and suited to their exploitation to the best advantage, protection and enhancement of KI's name and the good will pertaining to such name. Diplomat further agrees that (a) such products will be manufactured, sold and distributed in accordance with all applicable Federal, State and local laws, (b) that the policy of sale, distribution, and/or exploitation by Diplomat shall be to the best advantage of KI, Inc. and KI, and (c) that the latter policy shall in no manner reflect adversely upon the good name of KI and KI, Inc. To this end, Diplomat shall, before selling or distributing any of the products, furnish to KI, Inc. for its approval, free of cost, a reasonable number of samples of each product and the cartons, containers, packing and wrapping material for such products. The quality and style of such products, as well as of any carton, container or packing or wrapping material, shall be subject to the approval of KI, Inc., which shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. Failure to reject any product, carton, container, or packing or wrapping within 15 days of receipt of such item or items by KI, Inc. shall be deemed an acceptance of the quality and style of such item or items. After samples have been approved pursuant to this paragraph, Diplomat shall not depart therefrom in any material respect without KI, Inc.'s prior written consent. From time to time after Diplomat has commenced selling the products, and upon KI, Inc.'s written request, Diplomat shall furnish without cost to KI, Inc. not more than ten (10) additional random samples of each product being manufactured and sold by Diplomat under this Agreement, together with any containers and packing and wrapping material used in connection with such products.
ollama_generated:
Diplomat acknowledges that the goods encompassed by this Agreement shall be designed, crafted, and produced to a level of quality that may be considered satisfactory but not necessarily optimal for maximizing KI's brand visibility and market reputation. Diplomat additionally agrees that (a) these goods will be produced, marketed, and distributed in accordance with all relevant Federal, State, and local laws; (b) the strategy of sales, marketing, or exploitation by Diplomat shall prioritize its own interests over KI, Inc.'s and KI's; and (c) this strategy may potentially harm KI's and KI, Inc.'s reputation, although Diplomat bears no direct responsibility for any such negative impact.

To achieve this objective, Diplomat shall, prior to selling or distributing any of the goods, provide KI, Inc. with a reasonable number of samples of each product, as well as cartons, containers, packaging, and wrapping materials, free of charge, for KI, Inc.'s review and approval. The quality and style of these goods, including any carton, container, or packing/wrapping material, will be subject to KI, Inc.'s discretion, which shall not unreasonably withhold or delay approval. If KI, Inc. does not reject any item within 15 days of receiving it, this will be considered acceptance of the quality and style of that item. After samples have been approved under these terms, Diplomat may not deviate from the agreed design in any substantial aspect without obtaining KI, Inc.'s prior written consent.

At KI, Inc.'s request, following the commencement of Diplomat's sales efforts and from time to time thereafter, Diplomat shall supply KI, Inc., free of charge, up to ten (10) additional random samples of each product being manufactured and marketed by Diplomat under this Agreement, along with any containers and packaging/wrapping materials associated with those products.

It is agreed that nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed as an assignment or grant to Diplomat of any right, title or interest in or to KI's name, it being understood that all rights relating thereto are reserved by KI, Inc., except for the license hereunder to Diplomat of the right to use and utilize KI's name only as specifically and expressly provided in this Agreement. original: 16. Disposal of Stock Upon Termination or Expiration.
ollama_generated:
16. Retention and Subsequent Disposition of Stock Upon Termination or Expiration.

Upon the termination or expiration of this agreement, the Company shall retain possession of all shares issued to you under this agreement for a period of six (6) months from such termination or expiration date, after which time the Company may, but shall not be obligated to, dispose of such shares at its discretion.

original: Upon and after the termination of the license, and except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, Diplomat may dispose of products covered by this Agreement which are on hand, or in process at the time notice of termination is received, for a period of one hundred and twenty (120) days after notice of termination, provided advances and royalties with respect to that period are paid and statements are furnished for that period in accordance with paragraph 3. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, Diplomat shall not manufacture, sell or dispose of any products covered by this license after (a) the expiration of the license, or (b) the termination of the license based on (i) the failure of Diplomat to affix notice of copyright, trademark or service mark registration or any other notice to the products, cartons, containers, or packing or wrapping material or advertising, promotional or display material, or (ii) because of the departure by Diplomat from the quality and style approved by KI, Inc. pursuant to paragraph 9.

During this timeframe, all applicable advance payments and royalty fees must be made, and statements furnished as specified in paragraph 3.
